required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preoperative Oral Carbohydrate for Nausea and Vomiting Prevention During Cesarian Section
clinical_study.official_title: An Analysis of Risk Factors and Implementation of Strategies to Prevent Nausea and Vomiting in Patients Undergoing Regional Anesthesia for Caesarean Section

brief_summary.textblock: Post-operative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in women undergoing subarachnoid anesthesia for Caesarean section is an important clinical problem. The aim of this study is to compare the effectiveness of oral carbohydrate loading to standard pre-operative fasting in patients undergoing elective cesarean section on the incidence and severity of PONV and biochemical parameters indicating ketosis.

detailed_description.textblock: Post-operative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in women undergoing subarachnoid anesthesia for Caesarean section is an important clinical problem. Known mechanisms underlying PONV are based on prolonged fasting, hypotension due to concomitant sympatholysis during anesthesia, bradycardia due to increased vagal tone, visceral stimulation during surgery and intrathecal administered opioids. However, the identification of patients exposed to this problem and appropriate perioperative preparation is of key importance. An analysis of risk factors for postoperative nausea and vomiting in patients undergoing elective cesarean section under spinal anesthesia is of major clinical importance. The aim of this study is a comparison of the effectiveness of oral carbohydrate loading strategy as compared with standard pre-operative fasting in patients undergoing elective cesarean section under spinal anesthesia on the incidence and severity of PONV and biochemical parameters indicating ketosis.

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative nausea and vomiting 6 hours after caesarian section.
primary_outcome.description: The Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting (PONV) Intensity Scale 6 hours after caesarian section. Scale range: 0-50. The scale measures PONV intensity, where a score ≥50 defined clinically important PONV: PONV Intensity Scale=severity of nausea (1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe)×pattern of nausea (1=varying, 2=constant)×duration of nausea (in hours).

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative nausea and vomiting 24 hours after caesarian section.
primary_outcome.description: The Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting (PONV) Intensity Scale 24 hours after caesarian section. Scale range: 0-50. The scale measures PONV intensity, where a score ≥50 defined clinically important PONV: PONV Intensity Scale=severity of nausea (1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe)×pattern of nausea (1=varying, 2=constant)×duration of nausea (in hours).

secondary_outcome.description: Moment of first peristalsis after operation (in hours).
Moment of first bowel movement after operation (in hours).

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of serum lactate in serum.
secondary_outcome.description: Lactate level measured in maternal serum.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of beta-hydroxy-butiric acid in serum.
secondary_outcome.description: Beta-hydroxy-butiric acid level measured in maternal serum.
Insulin resistance measured in maternal serum.
Isoprostane level measured in maternal urine.

arm_group.description: 6 hours for solid food and 2 hours for liquids + oral carbohydrate preparation 2 hours prior to surgery.
6 hours for solid food and 2 hours for liquids.

intervention.description: Patients in the experimental arm will receive oral carbohydrate preparation at 2 hours prior to planned caesarian section.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age >=18 years.
2. Scheduled for an elective cesarean section.
3. Uncomplicated pregnancy.
4. Planned for spinal anesthesia.
5. ASA I or ASA II.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of diabetes.
2. History of gastro-intestinal reflux (GERD).
3. Unable or unwilling to sign an informed consent.
4. Contraindications to spinal anesthesia.
5. Contraindication to Oral carbohydrate formula.

eligibility.gender_description: Pregnant patients scheduled for planned cesarian section.
